question: Five people A, B, C, D, and E are sitting in a row facing north. A is sitting to the immediate right of B. C is not sitting at either end. D is sitting second to the left of E. Who is sitting at the extreme left?
explanation: D is 2nd left of E. A is immediate right of B. C not at ends. If E is at position 5, D is at 3. C not at ends means C at 2, 3, or 4. Arrangement: B-A-D-C-E. B is at extreme left.

question: Eight people are sitting around a circular table facing the center. P is third to the left of Q. R is second to the right of S. T is not adjacent to P. U is opposite to V. S is second to the left of Q. Who is sitting between R and T?
explanation: P is 3rd left of Q. S is 2nd left of Q. R is 2nd right of S. U opposite V. T not adjacent to P. Clockwise arrangement: Q-W-S-R-V-T-U-P. Between R and T is V.

question: Six friends P, Q, R, S, T, and U are sitting in a straight line. P is fourth from the right end. Q is between P and R. S is not at any end. U is immediate left of T. How many people are sitting between S and T?
explanation: P is 4th from right (position 3 from left). Q between P and R. U immediate left of T. S not at ends. Arrangement: R-Q-P-S-U-T. Between S(4) and T(6) are U, so 1 person. Actually checking positions again: need to verify.

question: Seven persons are sitting in a circle. A is third to the right of B. C is second to the left of A. D is not adjacent to B or C. E is second to the right of F. F is not adjacent to A. Who is sitting to the immediate left of D?
explanation: A is 3rd right of B. C is 2nd left of A. D not adjacent to B or C. E is 2nd right of F. F not adjacent to A. Clockwise: B-G-D-E-F-A-C. Immediate left of D is G.

question: Five students K, L, M, N, and O are sitting on a bench. K is to the left of L but to the right of M. N is not at the right end. O is at one of the ends. Who is sitting in the middle?
explanation: Order: M-K-L from given conditions. O at one end. N not at right end. If O at left: O-M-K-L-N. If O at right: N-M-K-L-O. In both cases, K is in middle position (3).

question: Eight persons A, B, C, D, E, F, G, and H are sitting in two rows facing each other. Row 1 has A, B, C, D facing south. Row 2 has E, F, G, H facing north. A is diagonally opposite to E. B is second to the right of A. F is at one end. Who is facing C?
explanation: Row 1 (south): A-D-B-C (B is 2nd right of A). Row 2 (north): E-G-F-H or similar. A diagonally opposite E means they're not directly facing. F at end. C faces G.

question: Six people are sitting around a hexagonal table, one on each side. P is opposite to Q. R is second to the left of P. S is adjacent to Q. T is not adjacent to R. Where is U sitting?
explanation: In hexagon, opposite means 3 positions away. P opposite Q. R is 2nd left of P. S adjacent to Q. T not adjacent to R. Arrangement: P-X-R-U-Q-S. U is opposite to R.

question: Seven friends are sitting in a row facing north. M is fourth from the left. N is second to the right of M. O is at one extreme end. P is between M and N. Q is not adjacent to O. Where is R sitting?
explanation: M at position 4. N is 2nd right of M (position 6). P between M and N (position 5). O at extreme. Q not adjacent to O. Arrangement: O-Q-S-M-P-N-R. R at extreme right.

question: Five people A, B, C, D, and E are sitting around a circular table facing outward. A is second to the right of B. C is third to the left of D. E is not adjacent to B. Who is sitting to the immediate right of C?
explanation: Facing outward reverses directions. A is 2nd right of B. C is 3rd left of D. E not adjacent to B. Counter-clockwise: B-A-E-C-D. Immediate right of C (clockwise) is E.

question: Six persons P, Q, R, S, T, and U are sitting in two rows of three each. P is in the middle of his row. Q faces R. S is to the immediate right of the person facing P. U is not at any end. Who is facing S?
explanation: P is middle of his row. Q faces R. S is immediate right of person facing P. U not at end. Row 1: R-P-T. Row 2: Q-U-S. Person facing P is U. S is right of U. T faces S.

question: Eight people A, B, C, D, E, F, G, and H are sitting in a circle facing the center. C is fourth to the left of G. E is second to the right of C. A is third to the left of E. B is not adjacent to G. How many people are sitting between D and F?
explanation: C is 4th left of G. E is 2nd right of C. A is 3rd left of E. B not adjacent to G. Clockwise: G-H-D-C-F-E-B-A. Between D and F (clockwise) are C, so 1. Between D and F (counter-clockwise) are H, G, A, B, E = 5. Minimum is 1.

question: Five students are sitting in a row facing south. K is to the right of L. M is to the left of L. N is between K and O. O is not at the right end. Who is at the extreme left?
explanation: Facing south reverses left-right. M left of L, L left of K gives M-L-K. N between K and O. O not at right end. Arrangement: M-L-K-N-O. M at extreme left.

question: Seven people P, Q, R, S, T, U, and V are sitting around a circular table. P is third to the right of Q. R is second to the left of S. T is between U and V. S is not adjacent to Q. U is second to the right of P. Who is sitting to the immediate left of R?
explanation: P is 3rd right of Q. R is 2nd left of S. T between U and V. S not adjacent to Q. U is 2nd right of P. Clockwise: Q-S-V-R-T-U-P. Immediate left of R is V.

question: Six friends are sitting in a straight line. A is third from the left. B is at one end. C is second to the right of D. E is not adjacent to A. F is between D and C. Who is sitting at the other end?
explanation: A at position 3. B at one end (position 1 or 6). C is 2nd right of D with F between. E not adjacent to A. Arrangement: B-D-F-A-C-E. E at other end.

question: Eight persons are sitting around a square table with two on each side. A and B are on the same side. C sits opposite to A. D is to the immediate right of C. E is second to the left of F. G is not adjacent to B. Who is sitting opposite to E?
explanation: A and B on same side. C opposite A. D immediate right of C. E is 2nd left of F. G not adjacent to B. Clockwise: A-B-H-F-C-D-G-E. E opposite F.

question: Five people K, L, M, N, and O are sitting on a bench. K is second from the right. L is not at any end. M is to the immediate left of K. N is to the left of O. Who is at the extreme left?
explanation: K at position 4 (2nd from right). M immediate left of K (position 3). L not at ends. N left of O. Arrangement: N-L-M-K-O or N-O-? Actually: N-L-M-K-O doesn't work. Let me recalculate: N-O-L-M-K. N at extreme left.

question: Six people are sitting in a circle facing the center. P is opposite to Q. R is third to the right of P. S is second to the left of R. T is adjacent to both P and S. Who is sitting between Q and R?
explanation: P opposite Q (3 positions apart). R is 3rd right of P. S is 2nd left of R. T adjacent to P and S. Clockwise: P-T-S-Q-U-R. Between Q and R (clockwise) are U. Between R and Q (clockwise) are P, T, S = 3. Actually between Q and R going clockwise is U.

question: Seven students A, B, C, D, E, F, and G are sitting in a row. A is at one end. B is third to the right of A. C is between B and D. E is second to the left of F. G is not at any end. Who is sitting in the middle?
explanation: A at position 1. B at position 4 (3rd right of A). C between B and D. E is 2nd left of F. G not at ends. Middle position is 4. B is at position 4, so B is in middle.

question: Eight friends are sitting around a circular table facing outward. M is fourth to the left of N. O is third to the right of M. P is second to the left of Q. R is not adjacent to N. S is opposite to T. Who is sitting second to the right of O?
explanation: Facing outward, M is 4th left of N. O is 3rd right of M. P is 2nd left of Q. R not adjacent to N. S opposite T. Counter-clockwise: N-R-O-S-M-P-T-Q. Second right of O (clockwise) is N.

question: Six persons P, Q, R, S, T, and U are sitting in two rows, three in each row. Row 1 faces north. P sits in Row 1 and is second from the left. R faces the person to the immediate right of P. T is in Row 2 and at one end. U faces Q. Who is in the middle of Row 2?
explanation: Row 1 (north): Q-P-S. P is 2nd from left. R faces person right of P (S faces R). Row 2 (south): T-U-R. T at end. U faces Q. U is middle of Row 2.

question: Five people A, B, C, D, and E are sitting in a row facing north. B is between A and C. D is second to the right of A. E is not at the left end. Who is sitting at the extreme right?
explanation: B between A and C gives A-B-C. D is 2nd right of A (position would be 3 if A at 1). E not at left. Arrangement: A-B-D-C-E or A-B-C-D-E. D at position 3 works with A-B-D-C-E. Then E at right.

question: Seven people are sitting in a circle. K is fourth to the left of L. M is third to the right of K. N is second to the left of M. O is not adjacent to L or M. P is between Q and N. Who is sitting to the immediate right of K?
explanation: K is 4th left of L. M is 3rd right of K. N is 2nd left of M. O not adjacent to L or M. P between Q and N. Clockwise: L-O-Q-K-P-N-M. Immediate right of K is P. Actually rechecking arrangement.

question: Six students P, Q, R, S, T, and U are sitting on a bench. P is at one end. Q is third from the right. R is between Q and S. T is second to the left of U. Who is sitting second from the left?
explanation: P at one end (1 or 6). Q at position 4 (3rd from right). R between Q and S. T is 2nd left of U. Arrangement: P-T-U-Q-R-S. T is 2nd from left.

question: Eight persons are sitting around a circular table. A is third to the right of B. C is second to the left of D. E is fourth to the right of F. G is not adjacent to A or C. H is between D and E. Who is sitting opposite to G?
explanation: A is 3rd right of B. C is 2nd left of D. E is 4th right of F. G not adjacent to A or C. H between D and E. Clockwise: B-F-G-D-H-E-A-C. G opposite C (4 positions in 8-person circle).

question: Five friends K, L, M, N, and O are sitting in a row facing south. K is at the left end. M is third from the left. N is to the immediate right of L. Where is O sitting?
explanation: Facing south. K at left end (position 1). M at position 3. N immediate right of L. Arrangement: K-L-M-N-O. O at right end (position 5).

question: Seven people A, B, C, D, E, F, and G are sitting around a circular table facing the center. A is second to the right of B. D is third to the left of C. E is not adjacent to B or D. F is second to the right of G. Who is sitting between A and C?
explanation: A is 2nd right of B. D is 3rd left of C. E not adjacent to B or D. F is 2nd right of G. Clockwise: B-C-G-A-F-E-D. Between A and C (going back) is G only.

question: Six people P, Q, R, S, T, and U are sitting in a straight line. P is fourth from the left. Q is between R and S. T is at one end. U is second to the right of R. Who is at the other end?
explanation: P at position 4. Q between R and S. T at one end. U is 2nd right of R. If T at position 1, arrangement: T-R-U-P-Q-S. S at other end (position 6).

question: Eight friends are sitting in two rows of four each, facing each other. Row 1 has A, B, C, D facing south. Row 2 has E, F, G, H facing north. A is at one end. B is second to the right of C. E faces C. G is at one end. Who faces B?
explanation: Row 1 (south): A-D-C-B or C-D-B-A (B is 2nd right of C). A at end, so: A-D-C-B. Row 2 (north): E-F-H-G (E faces C, G at end). B at position 4, H at position 3. Actually need to recheck facing positions.

question: Five people A, B, C, D, and E are sitting around a circular table. A is second to the left of B. C is opposite to D. E is not adjacent to A. D is second to the right of A. Who is sitting to the immediate right of E?
explanation: A is 2nd left of B. D is 2nd right of A. C opposite D. E not adjacent to A. In 5-person circle, opposite isn't clearly defined. Clockwise: B-D-E-C-A. Immediate right of E is C.

question: Seven students are sitting in a row. K is at one end. L is third to the right of K. M is between N and O. P is second to the left of Q. N is not adjacent to K. Who is sitting at the other end?
explanation: K at position 1. L at position 4 (3rd right of K). M between N and O. P is 2nd left of Q. N not adjacent to K. Arrangement: K-P-N-M-O-L-Q. Q at other end.

question: Six persons are sitting in a circle facing outward. P is third to the left of Q. R is second to the right of P. S is opposite to T. U is not adjacent to Q. T is second to the left of R. Who is sitting between S and U?
explanation: Facing outward. P is 3rd left of Q. R is 2nd right of P. S opposite T (3 positions). U not adjacent to Q. T is 2nd left of R. Counter-clockwise: Q-P-T-S-U-R. Between S and U is Q? Need to verify direction.

question: Eight people A, B, C, D, E, F, G, and H are sitting in a row facing north. C is fifth from the left. D is third to the right of A. E is between F and G. B is at one end. H is not adjacent to C. How many people are between A and E?
explanation: C at position 5. D is 3rd right of A. E between F and G. B at one end. H not adjacent to C. Without knowing exact position of A, we cannot determine people between A and E.

question: Five friends P, Q, R, S, and T are sitting on a bench. P is to the right of Q. R is to the left of Q. S is between P and T. T is not at the right end. Who is at the extreme left?
explanation: R left of Q, Q left of P gives R-Q-P. S between P and T. T not at right. Arrangement: R-Q-P-S-T. R at extreme left.

question: Seven people are sitting around a circular table. M is fourth to the right of N. O is third to the left of M. P is second to the right of O. Q is not adjacent to N or M. R is between S and P. Who is sitting to the immediate left of N?
explanation: M is 4th right of N. O is 3rd left of M. P is 2nd right of O. Q not adjacent to N or M. R between S and P. Clockwise: N-S-R-P-O-Q-M. Immediate left of N is S.

question: Six students K, L, M, N, O, and P are sitting in two rows of three each. K and L are in the same row. M faces N. O is to the immediate right of K. P is at one end of Row 2. L is not at any end. Who is facing O?
explanation: K and L in same row. O immediate right of K. L not at end. Row 1: K-O-L. M faces N. P at end of Row 2. Row 2: P-N-M. O at position 2 faces N at position 2.

question: Eight persons are sitting around a square table with two on each side, facing the center. A and B are on opposite sides. C is to the immediate left of D. E is second to the right of F. G is not on the same side as H. A is adjacent to E. Who is sitting opposite to C?
explanation: A and B opposite sides. C immediate left of D. E is 2nd right of F. G not same side as H. A adjacent to E. Clockwise: A-E-F-B-D-C-H-G. C opposite H.

question: Five people A, B, C, D, and E are sitting in a row. A is third from the left. B is at the right end. C is second to the left of B. D is not adjacent to A. Where is E sitting?
explanation: A at position 3. B at position 5 (right end). C at position 3 (2nd left of B). Wait, A and C both at 3? Recalculating: C is 2nd left of B(5) = position 3. But A is also at 3. Contradiction. Let me reconsider: maybe A at 3 from left is different position.

question: Seven friends P, Q, R, S, T, U, and V are sitting in a circle facing the center. P is third to the right of Q. R is second to the left of S. T is fourth to the left of U. V is not adjacent to Q. S is second to the right of P. Who is sitting between R and U?
explanation: P is 3rd right of Q. R is 2nd left of S. T is 4th left of U. V not adjacent to Q. S is 2nd right of P. Clockwise: Q-T-P-S-V-R-U. Between R and U (clockwise) is only U itself? Going backward from R: V. So V is between.

question: Six people K, L, M, N, O, and P are sitting in a straight line facing south. K is second from the right. L is fourth from the left. M is between K and N. O is not at any end. Where is P sitting?
explanation: Facing south. K at position 5 (2nd from right). L at position 4. M between K and N. O not at ends. If N at 6, M not between. If N at 3: arrangement P-O-N-L-M-K. P at extreme left.

question: Eight people are sitting in a circle. A is opposite to B. C is third to the right of D. E is second to the left of F. G is not adjacent to A or B. H is fourth to the right of C. D is second to the left of A. Who is sitting to the immediate right of B?
explanation: A opposite B (4 positions apart). C is 3rd right of D. E is 2nd left of F. G not adjacent to A or B. H is 4th right of C. D is 2nd left of A. Clockwise: A-E-F-B-G-D-H-C. Immediate right of B is G. Actually need to verify.

question: Five students A, B, C, D, and E are sitting on a bench facing north. B is between A and D. C is at one end. E is second to the right of C. Who is in the middle?
explanation: B between A and D gives A-B-D. C at one end. E is 2nd right of C. If C at position 1, E at position 3. Arrangement: C-A-B-D-E or C-E-A-B-D? C-A-B-D-E means E at 2 positions from C. So C-X-E. Arrangement: C-A-E-B-D. Middle (position 3) is E. Need recalculation.

question: Seven people M, N, O, P, Q, R, and S are sitting in a row. M is at one end. N is third to the left of O. P is between Q and R. S is second to the right of M. O is not at any end. Who is sitting second from the right end?
explanation: M at position 1. S at position 3 (2nd right of M). N is 3rd left of O. P between Q and R. O not at ends. Arrangement: M-N-S-O-P-Q-R. Position 6 (2nd from right) is Q.

question: Six persons are sitting around a hexagonal table facing the center. P is opposite to Q. R is third to the left of S. T is adjacent to P and S. U is not opposite to S. Who is sitting opposite to T?

question: Eight friends A, B, C, D, E, F, G, and H are sitting in two rows facing each other, four in each row. A is second from the left in his row. B faces the person to the immediate right of A. C is at one end. D faces E. F is in the same row as B. Who faces H?

question: Five people P, Q, R, S, and T are sitting in a circle facing outward. P is second to the left of Q. R is not adjacent to Q. S is third to the right of T. Who is sitting to the immediate left of R?
explanation: Facing outward. P is 2nd left of Q. R not adjacent to Q. S is 3rd right of T. Counter-clockwise: Q-S-T-R-P. Immediate left of R (counter-clockwise) is T. Actually with outward facing, immediate left would be P.

question: Seven students K, L, M, N, O, P, and Q are sitting in a row facing north. K is fourth from the right. L is third to the left of K. M is at one end. N is between O and P. Q is not adjacent to M. Who is at the extreme right?

question: Eight people are sitting in a circle facing the center. A is third to the right of B. C is fourth to the left of D. E is second to the right of A. F is opposite to G. H is not adjacent to B. D is second to the left of B. Who is sitting between E and F?

question: Six friends P, Q, R, S, T, and U are sitting on a bench. P is at one end. Q is third from the left. R is between S and T. U is not adjacent to P. S is second to the right of P. Who is sitting at the other end?

explanation: Fix one reference seat to remove circular rotation. Apply the immediate-right rule, then place the opposite seat. Completing the arrangement shows the first listed person opposite the second.

question: Eight persons A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H sit in a row facing north. A is second to the left of D. B is at one of the ends. C is immediate right of B. Who sits at the extreme right?
explanation: Place the end person first. Use second-left and immediate-right clues to fix positions. Completing remaining seats logically results in the first listed person occupying the extreme right seat.

question: Eight persons A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H sit around a circular table facing the center. A is immediate right of B. C is opposite A. Who sits opposite B?

explanation: Starting with R and U: U R. Q is second to R's left: Q _ R U. P is to Q's immediate right: Q P R U. S is not at an end, so S must be placed. The only remaining spot for T is at the extreme right. The arrangement is Q P R U S T. Therefore, T is at the extreme right end.

question: Five students—J, K, L, M, and N—are sitting in a row. K is to the left of L but to the right of J. M is to the right of L, and N is to the left of J. If they are all facing the same direction, who is in the middle?
explanation: Let's build the arrangement: K is left of L, right of J (J K L). M is right of L (J K L M). N is left of J (N J K L M). The full sequence is N J K L M. L is the person in the middle.

question: Six friends are sitting in a circle facing the center. A is between B and C. D is between E and F. E is to the immediate right of A. Who is sitting to the immediate left of D?
explanation: A is between B and C (B A C or C A B). E is to the immediate right of A, so the arrangement is B A E C. D is between E and F, so the sequence is B A E D F C. To the immediate left of D is F.

question: In a row of boys, if A, who is 10th from the left, and B, who is 9th from the right, interchange their positions, A becomes 15th from the left. How many boys are there in the row?
explanation: When A moves to B's original position, he is 15th from the left. This means B's original position was 15th from the left. Since B was also 9th from the right, the total number of boys is (15 + 9) - 1 = 23.

question: In a row of trees, one tree is 5th from either end of the row. How many trees are there in the row?
explanation: If a tree is 5th from both ends, it means there are 4 trees to its left and 4 trees to its right. So, the total number of trees is 4 + 4 + 1 = 9.

question: In a row of 40 girls, when Komal was shifted to her left by 4 places, her number from the left end of the row became 10. What was the number of Swati from the right end of the row if Swati was three places to the right of Komal's original position?
explanation: Komal's original position was 14th from the left. Swati is 17th from the left. Number of girls to the right of Swati is 40 - 17 = 23. So, Swati is 24th from the right end.

question: In a row of boys, A is 13th from the left and D is 17th from the right. If in this row A is 11th from the right, then what is the position of D from the left?

question: Eight friends are sitting in a circle. A is opposite B. C is to the immediate right of B. D is opposite C. E is to the immediate left of D. F is opposite E. Who is sitting to the immediate right of G?
explanation: The clockwise arrangement is A-H-E-D-C-B-G-F. The person to the immediate right of G is F.

question: In a row of 30 boys, A is 10th from the left. B is 9th from the right. How many boys are there between them?
explanation: B's position from the left is 30 - 9 + 1 = 22nd. A is 10th from the left. The number of boys between them is 22 - 10 - 1 = 11.

question: Six friends are sitting in a circle. A is to the immediate left of B. C is between A and E. D is to the immediate right of F. Who is sitting opposite to E?
explanation: The circular arrangement is B-A-C-E-F-D. F is sitting opposite to E.

explanation: Total number of boys = (A's position from left) + (B's position from right) + (boys in between) = 15 + 4 + 3 = 22.

question: Five friends are sitting on a bench. A is to the right of B. C is to the left of B. D is to the right of C but to the left of B. Who is sitting at the extreme left?
explanation: The arrangement from left to right is C, D, B, A. C is at the extreme left.

question: Eight friends are sitting in a circle. A is opposite B. C is to the immediate right of A. D is opposite C. E is to the immediate left of D. F is opposite E. G is to the right of F. Who is sitting opposite to F?
explanation: F is opposite E. The question is who is opposite F. The answer is E. It is given in the question. This is a trick question.

question: In a row of 25 students, A is 12th from the left. B is 10th from the right. How many students are there between them?
explanation: B's position from the left is 25 - 10 + 1 = 16th. A is 12th from the left. The number of students between them is 16 - 12 - 1 = 3.

question: Six friends are sitting in a circle. A is to the immediate left of B. C is between A and E. D is to the immediate right of F. Who is sitting opposite to B?
explanation: The circular arrangement is B-A-C-E-D-F. E is sitting opposite to B.

question: Five friends are sitting on a bench. A is to the left of B. C is to the right of B. D is between A and C, and B is between D and A. Who is sitting at the extreme right?
explanation: The arrangement is D, A, B, C. C is at the extreme right.

question: Six people—P, Q, R, S, T, and U—are sitting in a circle facing the center. P is sitting to the immediate right of Q. R is sitting between T and S. U is sitting between P and T. Who is sitting to the immediate left of R?
explanation: The circular arrangement is Q-P-U-T-R-S. Following this, T is to the immediate left of R.

question: Five friends—A, B, C, D, and E—are sitting in a row facing north. A is between C and D. E is not at any of the ends. B is to the immediate right of E. Who is at the extreme left end?
explanation: The arrangement must be D-A-C-E-B or C-A-D-E-B. Since E is not at an end and B is to its right, the arrangement must be D-C-A-E-B or C-D-A-E-B. In any valid arrangement, the person at the left end cannot be definitively determined between C and D, but A, E, and B cannot be there. The question is flawed; however, based on common structures, one of C or D must be at the end. Let's assume the question expects one specific arrangement, C-A-D-E-B. D would be at the left.

question: Eight people are sitting around a square table, two on each side. A and B are on the same side. C is opposite A. D is to the immediate right of C. E and F are on the same side, and F is opposite B. Who is sitting opposite G?
explanation: A and B are on one side, F is opposite B, so E and F are on the opposite side. C is opposite A. D is to the immediate right of C. The remaining person, H, sits next to A and B. G must be on the side with C and D. The person opposite G is D.

question: In a row of 35 students, Maya is 15th from the right end. What is her position from the left end?
explanation: To find the position from the other end, subtract the given position from the total number of students and add 1. So, Maya's position from the left end is (35 - 15) + 1 = 21st.

question: Seven people are sitting in a circle. A is between G and C. B is to the immediate right of G. D is second to the left of A. E is between F and C. Who is sitting second to the right of B?
explanation: The circular arrangement is G-B-D-F-E-C-A. Following this, C is sitting second to the right of B.

question: Six people are sitting in two parallel rows of three each. A, B, and C are in one row, and X, Y, and Z are in the other. A is opposite X. B is to the immediate right of A. Y is opposite B. Who is opposite C?
explanation: A is opposite X, and B is to A's right, so Y is opposite B. The only remaining person in that row is C, who must be opposite the only remaining person in the other row, Z.

question: In a row of boys, if Rohan, who is 12th from the left, and Sunil, who is 8th from the right, interchange their positions, Rohan becomes 22nd from the left. How many boys are there in the row?
explanation: After they interchange, Rohan is at Sunil's original position, which is 22nd from the left. Since this position is also 8th from the right, the total number of boys is (22 + 8) - 1 = 29.

question: Eight people—A to H—are sitting around a circular table. A is opposite E. F is second to the right of A. G is not a neighbor of A or E. B is to the immediate left of H. C is opposite G. Who is sitting to the immediate right of A?
explanation: Following the clues, a possible clockwise arrangement is A-C-D-E-H-B-G-F. In this arrangement, C is to the immediate right of A.

question: Five friends are sitting in a row. P is to the left of Q but to the right of R. S is to the right of Q but to the left of T. Who is in the middle?
explanation: The clues give the arrangement R-P-Q-S-T. In this line, Q is the person sitting in the middle.

question: Six friends are playing a game, sitting in a circle. A is facing D. B is to the right of D but left of C. E is to the left of A. Who is sitting opposite to C?
explanation: The arrangement in a clockwise direction is D-B-C-F-A-E. From this, it is clear that E is sitting opposite to C.

question: Seven cars are parked in a row. A red car is to the left of a blue car and to the right of a green car. A yellow car is parked at one end. A white car is parked next to the black car. A brown car is parked between the green and the red cars. Which car is parked in the middle?
explanation: The arrangement is Green-Brown-Red-Blue. This is a block of 4. With 7 cars, the middle (4th) position must be one of these. The block is Green-Brown-Red-Blue. The middle car is the Red car.

question: Eight people are sitting in a circle. A is facing B. C is two places to the right of A. D is not a neighbor of A or B. E is opposite D. Who is sitting to the immediate left of C?
explanation: Based on the arrangement, a possible clockwise order is A-G-C-B-H-D-F-E. In this case, G is to the left of C. Wait, let's re-evaluate. The order could be A-H-C-G-B-F-D-E. H is to the left of C. Let's try to be more systematic. A is opposite B. C is 2 places to the right of A. E is opposite D. The arrangement A-F-C-H-B-G-D-E satisfies the conditions. F sits to the immediate left of C.

question: Eight people P, Q, R, S, T, U, V, W sit in a straight line facing north. P sits third to the left of V. Only two people sit between R and T. S sits second to the right of T. U is an immediate neighbour of P. Q sits at an extreme end. Who sits second to the right of U?
explanation: Arrangement: Q U P R T S V W. Second to the right of U is T.

question: Seven friends A, B, C, D, E, F, G sit in a row facing south. B sits third to the right of F. C is at one extreme end. E sits second to the left of G. Only one person sits between A and D. Who sits immediately left of G?
explanation: Arrangement: C F B A D E G. Immediate left of G is E.

question: Nine people sit around a circular table facing the centre. A sits second to the left of B. C sits third to the right of D. E is opposite F. G sits between B and H. I is immediate left of A. Who is opposite A?
explanation: Clockwise order example: A I B G H C D F E. Opposite A is H.

question: Ten people sit in two parallel rows of five each. Row 1 (facing south): A B C D E. Row 2 (facing north): P Q R S T. B faces Q. C is second left of E. S faces D. P is extreme left of Row 2. Who faces A?
explanation: Row1: A B C D E (south), Row2: P Q R S T (north). A faces T.

question: Eight persons sit around a circle facing centre. M sits third right of N. O is second left of P. Q sits between N and R. S is opposite M. Who sits immediate right of O?
explanation: Typical order: N Q R M S ... O P. Immediate right of O is P.

question: Six boys X Y Z W V U sit in a line. X is immediate left of Y. Z is third right of W. V is second left of U. Only one person between Y and W. Who is at extreme right?
explanation: Arrangement: W Y X Z V U. Extreme right is U.

question: Seven people sit in a circle facing outward. K sits opposite L. M is second right of N. O sits third left of P. Who is immediate left of M?
explanation: Facing outward changes left-right. Typical arrangement leads to N immediate left of M.

question: Eight friends sit in a row. A sits third left of E. Only two between B and F. G sits immediate right of C. D sits second right of H. Who sits extreme left?
explanation: Arrangement: A B C G D H F E. Extreme left is A.

question: Six people sit around a round table facing centre. P is opposite R. Q sits second right of S. T is immediate left of P. Who sits between Q and T?
explanation: Opposite clue creates two possible arrangements; position between Q and T not fixed.

question: Nine persons in a line facing north. J third left of K. L middle. M second right of N. O immediate neighbour of P and Q. Who fourth right of O?
explanation: L is 5th (middle). Typical arrangement leads to fourth right of O being L.

question: Five people sit in a row. A left of B but not next to C. D right of C. E at end. Who middle?
explanation: Arrangement: E A B C D or similar; C is middle.

question: Eight sit circular facing centre. X third right of Y. Z second left of W. V opposite U. Who second left of X?
explanation: Arrangement leads to Z second left of X.

question: Ten in two rows. Row1 north: 1 2 3 4 5. Row2 south: A B C D E. 3 faces C. 1 left of 2. Who faces 5?
explanation: Row1: 1 2 3 4 5 (north), Row2: B A C D E or similar; 5 faces E.

question: Seven in line. Only one between M and N. O third left of M. P immediate right of N. Who second right of O?

question: Seven friends P, Q, R, S, T, U, V sit in a row facing north. Q sits third to the left of V. R sits second to the right of S. Only one person sits between P and T. U sits at extreme left. Who sits second to the right of P?

question: Nine people sit around a circular table facing centre. M sits second to the right of N. O sits third left of P. Q is opposite R. S sits between N and T. Who is immediate left of O?
explanation: Typical clockwise: N S T ... O P. Immediate left of O is P.

question: Ten people in two parallel rows. Row 1 (north): K L M N O. Row 2 (south): 1 2 3 4 5. L faces 2. N faces 4. O is extreme right of Row 1. Who faces K?
explanation: Row1: K L M N O, Row2: 1 2 3 4 5. K faces 1.

question: Eight circular facing centre. Alpha third left of Beta. Gamma second right of Delta. Who immediate right of Gamma?
explanation: Immediate right of Gamma is Delta.

question: Ten two rows. Row1: 1-5 north. Row2: A-E south. 2 faces B. 4 faces D. Who faces 5?

question: Seven line. Only two between X and Y. Z immediate left of Y. W third right of V. Who extreme right?

question: Eight circular. M opposite N. O third right of P. Q between P and R. Who second left of O?
explanation: Second left of O is P.

explanation: Typical arrangement: positions 1-6, L in middle (3rd or 4th).

question: Nine circular facing centre. A opposite B. C second left of D. E third right of F. Who immediate neighbour of A?

explanation: Fourth right of Alpha is Zeta.

explanation: Third right of R is U.

explanation: Row2: say 1 2 3 4 5. Immediate left of 3 is 2.

explanation: Second left of Z is Y.

question: Nine line. P second right of Q. R third left of S. T middle. Who immediate neighbour of T?
explanation: T middle (5th), neighbours depend on other clues, not fixed.

explanation: Arrangement leads to Epsilon extreme right.

explanation: Immediate right of E is F or A depending, typical A.

question: Six row. J immediate left of K. L third right of M. N second left of O. Who second right of J?
explanation: Second right of J is L.

question: Ten two rows. Row1 A B C D E north. Row2 P Q R S T south. A faces P. C faces R. Who faces B?
explanation: Direct facing: B faces Q.

question: Seven circular facing centre. X opposite Y. Z second right of W. V third left of U. Who immediate left of Z?
explanation: Immediate left of Z is W.

question: Eight line. Alpha second right of Beta. Gamma immediate left of Delta. Epsilon third right of Zeta. Who extreme left?
explanation: Arrangement leads to Zeta extreme left.

question: Nine circular. P opposite Q. R third right of S. T between S and U. Who second right of T?
explanation: Second right of T is R.

question: Six friends A, B, C, D, E and F are sitting in a row facing East. C is between A and E. B is just to the right of E but left of D. F is not at the right end. Who is at the right end?
explanation: Arrangement: F - A - C - E - B - D. Since F is not at the right end (he is at the left), D is at the extreme right end.

question: Eight persons P, Q, R, S, T, U, V and W are sitting around a circular table facing the centre. R is third to the left of P. T is second to the right of P. Q is second to the right of S. S is not an immediate neighbour of P or T. U is not a neighbour of S. Who is sitting opposite S?
explanation: Arrangement: P - V - T - W - R - Q - U - S. S is opposite T.

question: Five boys are sitting in a row. A is to the right of B, E is to the left of B but to the right of C. A is to the left of D. Who is second from the left end?
explanation: Order: C - E - B - A - D. The second person from the left is E.

question: A, B, C, D, E, and F are sitting in a circle facing the center. A is neighbor of B and C. D is neighbor of C and E. B is neighbor of F. Who is neighbor of E and F?
explanation: Order: A - B - F - (Gap) - E - D - C. Wait. A is neighbor of B and C (B-A-C). D is neighbor of C and E (C-D-E). So B-A-C-D-E. B is neighbor of F. So E-F-B. Cycle: A-C-D-E-F-B. Neighbor of E and F is nobody (they are neighbors of each other). Wait. Is there a person between? No, 6 people. E and F are neighbors. The question asks 'Who is neighbor of E and F' implying a person between them. But in this arrangement E and F are adjacent. Answer is None/Data mismatch if implied 'between'.

question: Five girls are sitting on a bench to be photographed. Seema is to the left of Rani and to the right of Bindu. Mary is to the right of Rani. Reeta is between Rani and Mary. Who is sitting immediate right to Reeta?
explanation: Order: Bindu - Seema - Rani - Reeta - Mary. Immediate right of Reeta is Mary.

question: Six persons are sitting in a circle. A is facing B. B is to the right of E and left of C. C is to the left of D. F is to the right of A. Now D exchanges his seat with F and E with B. Who is sitting to the left of D?
explanation: Original Order (Clockwise): E-B-C-D-F-A. Swap D/F, E/B. New: B-E-C-F-D-A. Left of D is A.

question: In a row of students, if John is 16th from the left and Johnson is 8th from the right, and there are 5 students between them, how many students are there in the row?
explanation: Total = 16 (John) + 8 (Johnson) + 5 (Between) = 29.

question: A, B, C, D and E are sitting in a row facing North. A is between B and D. E is to the right of D and at the end. Who is to the left of B?
explanation: Order: C - B - A - D - E. C is to the left of B.

question: Eight friends are sitting in a circle facing the centre. A is 2nd left of B. C is 2nd left of A. D is 2nd left of C. E is 2nd left of D. F is 2nd left of E. Who is opposite A?
explanation: Every 2nd left means skipping one person. A-x-B... wait. A is 2nd left of B means A is at B-2. C is at A-2 = B-4. D is at C-2 = B-6. E is at D-2 = B-8 (or B). This creates a square pattern A-C-E-G using odd/even logic. Opposite A is D.

question: Six persons are sitting in a row. A is to the left of B. C is to the right of B. D is to the left of A. E is to the left of D. F is to the right of C. Who are the neighbors of B?
explanation: Order: E - D - A - B - C - F. Neighbors of B are A and C.

question: Five people A, B, C, D and E are sitting in a row. A is to the left of B but to the right of C. D is to the right of B but to the left of E. Who is at the extreme left?
explanation: Order: C - A - B - D - E. C is at the extreme left.

question: Six friends M, N, O, P, Q and R are sitting in a circle facing the centre. N is between O and P. M is between O and Q. R and P are standing together. Who is sitting between M and R?
explanation: Order: Q - M - O - N - P - R. Between M and R is Q.

question: In a row of 40 students facing North, R is 11th from the left and S is 31st from the left. How far is S from R?
explanation: Position difference: 31 - 11 = 20.

question: Seven friends are sitting in a row. P is exactly in the middle. Q is to the left of P but right of S. T is to the right of P. R is to the right of S but left of Q. Who is at the extreme left?
explanation: Order: S - R - Q - P - T - (others). S is at the extreme left.

question: Five friends are sitting on a bench. A is to the left of B but on the right of C. D is to the right of B but on the left of E. Who are at the extremes?
explanation: Order: C - A - B - D - E. Extremes are C and E.

question: Five friends are sitting in a circle facing center. A is left of B. C is between B and D. E is right of A. Who is right of C?
explanation: Order: E - A - B - C - D. Right of C (Anti-clockwise) is B.

question: Six persons are sitting in a circle facing the center. Parikh is between Babita and Narendra. Asha is between Chitra and Pankaj. Chitra is to the immediate left of Babita. Who is to the immediate right of Babita?
explanation: Order: Babita - Parikh - Narendra - Pankaj - Asha - Chitra. Right of Babita is Parikh.

question: Six people A, B, C, D, E and F are sitting in a hexagon shape. A is opposite D. B is opposite E. C is opposite F. A is between B and F. Who is between E and C?
explanation: Order: A-B-C-D-E-F. Between E and C is D.

question: A, B, C, D and E are sitting in a row facing North. C is 2 places away from A. E is 2 places away from D. B is at the middle. A is at the left end. Who is at the right end?
explanation: A - D - B - C - E. E is at the right end.

question: In a row of 25 girls, when Neha was shifted by four places towards the left, she became 10th from the left end. What was her earlier position from the right end?
explanation: New pos = 10L. Old pos = 10+4 = 14L. From Right = 25 - 14 + 1 = 12th.

question: Six people A, B, C, D, E and F are sitting in a row. A and F are at the ends. B is sitting to the immediate right of A. C is neighbor of D but not E. Who is to the left of F?
explanation: Order: A - B - D - C - E - F. Left of F is E.

question: Eight friends are sitting in a circle facing the centre. A is opposite D. B is neighbor of A and C. E is neighbor of D and F. G is neighbor of F and H. Who is neighbor of B and H?
explanation: Order: A - B - C - H - D - E - F - G (Possible). If B is neighbor of A and C, and H is neighbor of C, then C is neighbor of B and H.

question: Five students K, L, M, N and O are sitting on a bench. N is to the left of K. M is to the right of O. L is between N and K. Who is to the left of N?
explanation: Order: O - M - N - L - K. Left of N is M (or O further left). Wait. M is right of O. N is left of K. L between N and K (N-L-K). If O-M are left of N, then M is immediate left.

question: In a class, P is 15th from the top and Q is 25th from the bottom. If there are 10 students between them, how many students are there in total?
explanation: Max case: 15 + 25 + 10 = 50. (Min case check: 15+25-10-2 = 28. Usually max unless specified).

question: Six friends are sitting in a circle facing the centre. A is immediate left of B. C is immediate right of F. D is between A and F. Who is opposite E?
explanation: Order: B - A - D - F - C - E. Opposite E is D.

question: Five persons are sitting in a row facing North. A is to the right of B. E is to the right of A. D is to the left of B. C is to the left of D. Who is second from the right?
explanation: Order: C - D - B - A - E. 2nd from right is A.

question: A, B, C, D and E are sitting in a circle. A is between B and E. C is to the immediate right of D. D is to the immediate right of E. Who is to the immediate left of B?
explanation: Order: B - A - E - D - C. Left of B is C.

question: In a row of boys, A is 10th from the left. B is 15th from the right. If A and B interchange, A becomes 15th from the left. How many boys are there?
Six people P, Q, R, S, T and U are sitting in a circular path. P is facing S. Q is to the left of T and right of P. R is to the left of U. U is to the left of S. Who is right of R?
explanation: Order: P - Q - T - S - U - R. Right of R is P? Wait. R left of U. U left of S. S-U-R. Right of R is U (Anti-Clockwise).

question: Seven persons are sitting in a row. A is in the middle. B and C are at the ends. D is next to B. E is next to C. F is to the right of A. Who is to the left of A?
explanation: Order: B - D - G - A - F - E - C. Left of A is G? Wait. Missing person G. Left of A is G or D depending on F's position.

question: Five friends are sitting on a bench. P is to the left of Q. R is to the right of P. S is to the left of P. T is to the right of Q. Who is in the middle?
explanation: Order: S - P - R - Q - T. Middle is R? Wait. R is right of P. Q is right of P (since P is left of Q). T right of Q. Order could be S-P-R-Q-T or S-P-Q-R-T. 'P is left of Q', 'R right of P', 'T right of Q'. If R is between P and Q, middle is R. If R is right of Q, middle is Q. Standard assumption is immediate neighbors. S-P-R-Q-T. Middle is R. Option C says Q. If S-P-Q-R-T, middle is Q. 'R right of P' and 'P left of Q' allows both.

question: Four girls A, B, C and D are sitting in a circle. B and C are facing each other. Which of the following is definitely true?
choices: A) A and D are facing each other
B) A is to the left of B
C) D is to the right of C
explanation: In a circle of 4, if two are opposite, the other two must be opposite each other.

question: Five persons are sitting in a row. X is at the left of Y. Z is at the right of W. V is at the right of X. W is at the left of Y. If Z is at one end, who is in the middle?
explanation: Order: W - Z - X - V - Y ? No. Z is right of W. Z is at one end (Right end). Order: W - X - V - Y - Z. Middle is V? Or X - V - W - Y - Z. Too many variables. If X-W-V-Y-Z.

question: Six friends are sitting in a circle. A is facing B. C is to the right of B. D is to the left of A. E is to the right of F. F is to the left of C. Who is to the right of A?
explanation: Order: B - C - F - E - A - D. Right of A is E.

question: In a row of students, R is 5th from the left and T is 12th from the right. If they interchange positions, R becomes 18th from the left. How many students are there?
Five friends are sitting in a row facing North. M is to the left of N. O is to the right of P. P is to the right of N. Q is to the left of M. Who is sitting at the extreme right?
explanation: Order: Q - M - N - P - O. Extreme right is O.

question: Eight people are sitting in two parallel rows. Row 1 (South): A, B, C, D. Row 2 (North): P, Q, R, S. A sits opposite P. B sits opposite S. C is to the right of A. R is to the left of P. Who faces D?
explanation: Row 1: D - B - A - C. Row 2: Q - S - P - R. D faces Q.

question: Six friends are sitting in a circle. K is to the left of L. M is between L and N. O is between K and N. P is to the right of K. Who is between L and P?
explanation: Order: L - M - N - O - K - P. Between L and P is K.

question: A, B, C, D and E are sitting in a row. A is the neighbor of B. C is the neighbor of D. E is the neighbor of A. D is not the neighbor of A. Who is the neighbor of B?
explanation: Order: E - A - B - C - D. Neighbors of B are A and C. Option D says Both A and E? No. Maybe E-A-B-D-C? D not neighbor of A. D is neighbor of C. Order D-C-B-A-E. Neighbors of B are C and A.

question: Seven persons P, Q, R, S, T, U and V are sitting in a circle. P is second to the right of T. T is third to the right of Q. S is third to the left of P. V is immediate left of S. U is second to the right of V. Who is second to the left of R?
explanation: Order: Q - V - S - T - R - P - U. Second left of R is T.

question: In a row of boys, A is 13th from the left and B is 10th from the right. If they interchange their positions, A becomes 20th from the left. How many boys are there in the row?
explanation: Total = New A(20) + Old B(10) - 1 = 29.

question: Five persons are sitting in a row. A is 2nd to the right of B. C is 3rd to the left of D. E is at one end. A is in the middle. What is the order?
choices: A) E B A C D
B) C E B A D
C) E B A D C
D) C B A E D
explanation: A is middle. C B A E D. C is 3rd left of D (Wait. 1-C, 2-B, 3-A, 4-E, 5-D. C is 4 places away). C is 3rd left of D means C _ _ D. Pos 1 and 4? or 2 and 5? If order C-B-A-E-D. C(1) to D(5) is 4 steps. Valid is C-E-B-A-D? No. Try B-E-A-C-D. A is 2nd right of B (B _ A). Yes.

question: Six friends are sitting in a circle facing the centre. F is immediate left of A. B is opposite E. A and D are opposite each other. Who is immediate right of B?
explanation: Order: A - F - B - D - C - E. Right of B is D? Or C? Wait. B is opp E. A opp D. F left of A. A-F-E-D-C-B. Right of B is A? No.

question: Five friends are sitting on a bench. A is left of B. C is right of D. D is right of B. E is left of C. Who is in the middle?
explanation: Order: A - B - D - E - C. Middle is D.

question: In a row of girls, Kamla is 9th from the left and Veena is 16th from the right. If they interchange their positions, Kamla becomes 25th from the left. How many girls are there in the row?

Eight persons A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H are sitting in a circle facing the centre. A is fourth to the right of H. F is second to the right of H. B is third to the right of F. G is third to the left of A. E is immediate left of D. Who is immediate left of C?
explanation: Order: H - (gap) - F - (gap) - A - (gap) - (gap) - (gap). Full map: H-C-F-E-D-A-G-B. Left of C is H. Left of E is F. Correct map needed.

question: Six friends are sitting in a row facing North. C is sitting between A and E. D is not at the end. B is sitting at immediate right of E. F is not at the right end. Who is at the right end?
explanation: Order: F - A - C - E - B - D. D is at the right end.

question: Five students are sitting in a row. S is to the right of L. P is to the left of L but to the right of K. D is to the left of K. Who is sitting first from the left?
explanation: Order: D - K - P - L - S. D is first from left.

question: Six friends A, B, C, D, E and F are sitting in a circle. C is to the left of D. F is between A and E. E is between F and D. Who is to the left of F?
explanation: Order: A - F - E - D - C - B. Left of F is E.

question: In a row of boys, A is 15th from the left and B is 4th from the right. There are 3 boys between A and B. C is just left of A. What is C's position from the right?
explanation: Total = 15 + 4 + 3 = 22. C is 14th from left. From right = 22 - 14 + 1 = 9th.

question: A, B, C, D, and E are sitting on a bench. A is sitting next to B, C is sitting next to D, D is not sitting with E who is on the left end of the bench. C is on the second position from the right. A is to the right of B and E. A and C are sitting together. In which position is A sitting?
explanation: Arrangement: E - B - A - C - D. E is at the left end. C is second from right. D is next to C (so D is at the right end). A is next to B and C. A is between B and C.

question: P, Q, R, S, T, U, V, and W are sitting round the circle and are facing the centre. P is second to the right of T who is the neighbour of R and V. S is not the neighbour of P. V is the neighbour of U. Q is not between S and W. W is not between U and S. Who is sitting opposite to U?
explanation: The circular order clockwise is: T - P - U - V - R - S - Q - W (or similar variation). Actually, simpler: T is neighbour of R and V. P is 2nd right of T. V is neighbour of U. Solving fully places P opposite U.

question: Six friends are sitting in a circle and are facing the centre of the circle. Deepa is between Prakash and Pankaj. Priti is between Mukesh and Lalit. Prakash and Mukesh are opposite to each other. Who is sitting right to Prakash?
explanation: Deepa is between Prakash and Pankaj. So the order is Pankaj-Deepa-Prakash. Priti is between Mukesh and Lalit. Prakash is opposite Mukesh. To the right of Prakash (facing center) is Deepa.

question: A, P, R, X, S and Z are sitting in a row. S and Z are in the centre. A and P are at the ends. R is sitting to the left of A. Who is to the right of P?
explanation: Ends are A and P. R is left of A, so A is at the right end. P is at the left end. Order: P - X - S/Z - Z/S - R - A. To the right of P is X.

question: A, B, C, D and E are sitting in a row facing North. E is sitting at one of the ends. A is next to E. B is next to A but not C. D is left of C. Who is at the extreme right end?
explanation: If E is left end: E-A-B-D-C. If E is right end: C-D-B-A-E (D is left of C holds). Usually 'next to' implies direction. If A is next to E, B next to A. D left of C implies order D-C. E-A-B-D-C works.

question: Five girls are sitting in a row. Rashi is not adjacent to Sulekha or Abha. Anuradha is not adjacent to Sulekha. Rashi is adjacent to Monika. Monika is at the middle in the row. Then, Anuradha is adjacent to whom out of the following?
explanation: Monika is middle (3rd). Rashi is adjacent to Monika (2nd or 4th). Rashi not next to Sulekha/Abha. If Rashi is 2nd, 1st is Anuradha (since not Sulekha/Abha). Order: Anuradha-Rashi-Monika-Sulekha-Abha. Anuradha is adjacent to Rashi.

question: Five students are sitting in a circle. T is to the right of Z. M is second to the left of Z. L is not the immediate neighbor of T or Z. Who is to the immediate left of T?
explanation: Clockwise: Z, T. M is 2nd left of Z (so right of T). Circle: Z - T - M - (Gap) - (Gap). L not next to T or Z, so L is between M and Z? No. L must be far. Actually, Z is immediate left of T.

question: Six persons are sitting in a circle facing the center. A is facing B. B is to the right of E and left of C. C is to the left of D. F is to the right of A. Now D exchanges his seat with F and E with B. Who will be sitting to the left of D?
explanation: Original: E-B-C-D-F-A (clockwise). After swap: B-E-C-F-D-A. Left of D is A.

question: In a row of boys, If A who is 10th from the left and B who is 9th from the right interchange their positions, A becomes 15th from the left. How many boys are there in the row?
explanation: A's new position is 15th from left. This is B's old spot (9th from right). Total = (15 + 9) - 1 = 23.

question: A, B, C, D, E, F and G are sitting in a row facing North. F is to the immediate right of E. E is 4th to the right of G. C is the neighbour of B and D. Person who is third to the left of D is at one of the ends. Who are to the left of C?
choices: D) D, E, F and A
explanation: Row: G - B - C - D - E - F - A. (E is 4th right of G). 3rd left of D is G (end). Neighbors of C are B and D. Left of C are G and B.

question: Eight friends A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H are sitting in a circle facing the centre. B is sitting between G and D. H is third to the left of B and second to the right of A. C is sitting between A and G. Who is sitting between B and E?
explanation: Arrangement clockwise: A-C-G-B-D-F-H-E. Between B and E? B is next to D. E is next to H. Wait, D is next to B. So D is between B and E? Actually D is between B and F. Checking: D is between B and E.

question: Six persons are sitting in a circle. A is to the immediate left of B. B is to the immediate left of C. C is to the immediate left of D. D is to the immediate left of E. E is to the immediate left of F. F is to the immediate left of A. Who is to the left of B?
explanation: The order is A-F-E-D-C-B (Anti-clockwise) or B-C-D-E-F-A (Clockwise if facing center and 'left' means clockwise). Usually, 'A is left of B' means B->A. So order: B->A->F->E->D->C->B. Left of B is A? Question says B is left of C. C->B. So order C->B->A... Left of B is A.

question: Five people A, B, C, D and E are seated about a round table. Every chair is spaced equidistant from each other. C is seated next to A. A is seated two seats from D. B is not seated next to A. Who is seated next to B?
explanation: Order: A - C - E - B - D. A is 2 seats from D (A..D). B not next to A. Neighbors of B are D and E.

question: In a class of 35 students, Kunal is placed seventh from the bottom whereas Sonali is placed ninth from the top. Pulkit is placed exactly in between the two. What is Kunal's position from Pulkit?
explanation: Sonali = 9 (Top). Kunal = 7 (Bottom) = 35-7+1 = 29 (Top). Middle of 9 and 29 = (9+29)/2 = 19. Pulkit is 19. Kunal is 29. Difference is 10.

question: Six friends are sitting in a circle and are facing the centre of the circle. R is between T and U. P is between V and S. T is to the immediate left of S. Who is to the immediate left of R?
explanation: Clockwise: S-T-R-U-P-V. T is left of S (if facing center). R is between T and U. Left of R is U.

question: A, B, C, D and E are sitting in a row facing North. A is between B and D. E is to the right of D and at the end. Who is to the left of B?
explanation: Order: C - B - A - D - E. E is right end. A is between B and D. Only C remains for left of B.

question: Eight people A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H are placed in this manner. All are facing outwards. If all of them move two positions in clockwise direction, then who will be facing North-West? (Assume A started at North and order is clockwise A-H)
explanation: Positions: N(A), NE(B), E(C), SE(D), S(E), SW(F), W(G), NW(H). Shift 2 clockwise. H moves to NE. A moves to E. B moves to SE. Wait. H was NW. H moves to NE? No. Clockwise: NW -> N -> NE. H is at NE. Who moves TO NW? F (SW) -> W -> NW. So F is at NW.

question: Five boys are standing in a row facing East. P is to the left of T, Q is to the right of S. T is to the left of Q. S is to the left of P. Who is standing at the extreme right end?
explanation: Facing East (Right is South, Left is North). But in linear usually Left/Right refers to line order. Order: S - P - T - Q. Q is right of S. T left of Q. P left of T. S left of P. Extreme right is Q.

question: Four ladies A, B, C and D and four Gentlemen E, F, G and H are sitting in a circle around a round table facing each other. No two ladies or two gentlemen are sitting side by side. C, who is sitting between G and E, is facing D. F is between D and A and facing G. H is to the right of B. Who is sitting to the left of E?
explanation: Order: G - C - E - A - H - B - F - D (or similar). C is between G and E. F is between D and A. H right of B. Left of E is A.

question: In a row of girls, Rita and Monika occupy the ninth place from the right end and tenth place from the left end, respectively. If they interchange their places, then Rita and Monika occupy seventeenth place from the right and eighteenth place from the left respectively. How many girls are there in the row?
explanation: Monika new pos = 18th from left. This was Rita's old pos (9th from right). Total = 18 + 9 - 1 = 26.

question: Six persons A, B, C, D, E and F are standing in a circle. B is between D and C. A is between E and C. F is to the right of D. Who is between A and F?
explanation: Order: F - D - B - C - A - E. F is right of D. A is between E and C. Between A and F is E.

question: In a row of children, A is 13th from the left and D is 17th from the right. If in this row A is 11th from the right then what is the position of D from the left?
explanation: Total = A(Left) + A(Right) - 1 = 13 + 11 - 1 = 23. D's pos from left = 23 - 17 + 1 = 7th.

question: A, B, C, D and E are sitting in a circle facing the centre. C is neighbour of A and B. E is to the immediate left of B. Who is to the immediate right of A?
explanation: Order: E - B - C - A - D. C between A and B. E left of B. Right of A is D.

question: Five friends P, Q, R, S and T are sitting in a row facing North. Here, S is between T and Q and Q is to the immediate left of R. P is to the immediate left of T. Who is in the middle?
explanation: Order: P - T - S - Q - R. P left of T. S between T and Q. Q left of R. Middle is S.

question: Six friends are sitting in a circle facing the center. A is to the left of B. C is between B and D. E is between A and F. Who is to the immediate right of A?
explanation: Order (Clockwise for Left): B -> A -> E -> F -> D -> C -> B. A is left of B. Right of A is E (Counter-clockwise).

question: Five people A, B, C, D and E are sitting in a row. A is to the left of B but to the right of C. D is to the right of B but to the left of E. Who is at the extreme left?
explanation: Order: C - A - B - D - E. C is at the extreme left.

question: Eight persons A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H are sitting in a circle facing the centre. A is opposite to G and to the immediate right of B. E is to the immediate left of G. H is to the immediate right of F. F is to the immediate right of A. Who is to the immediate right of H?
explanation: Clockwise: B-A-F-H-D-G-E-C. Right of H is D.

question: In a queue, A is 18th from the front while B is 16th from the back. If C is 25th from the front and is exactly in the middle of A and B, then how many persons are there in the queue?
explanation: A=18, C=25. Persons between A and C = 6. So persons between C and B = 6. B is 25+6+1 = 32nd from front. Total = 32(front) + 16(back) - 1 = 47.

question: Six friends A, B, C, D, E and F are sitting in a row facing East. C is between A and E. B is just to the right of E but left of D. F is not at the right end. Who is at the left end?
explanation: Order (Left is North for East facing, but assuming left/right of line): F - A - C - E - B - D. F is at left end.

question: Five persons are sitting in a row. D is right of E. B is left of E. A is right of C. B is right of A. Who is sitting in the middle?
explanation: Order: C - A - B - E - D. Middle is B.

question: A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H are sitting around a square table. Four sit at corners, four in middle of sides. Corner ones face center, middle ones face outside. A is at a corner. B is 2nd to right of A. C is 3rd to left of B. Who sits immediate left of C?
explanation: A (Corner, In). Right of A is Middle (Out). 2nd Right is B (Corner, In). 3rd Left of B: B faces In, Left is CW. 1-Mid, 2-Corn, 3-Mid. So C is Mid (Out). Immediate left of C (Out) is Clockwise. That is B.

question: Six persons are sitting in a circle facing the center. P is second to the right of Q. R is second to the left of Q. S is immediate right of R. Who is opposite to T?
explanation: Clockwise: Q - (gap) - P. R is 2nd left (Q - gap - R). So R is opp P. S is imm right of R. Order: R-S-Q-T-P-U. Opposite T is S.

question: In a row of boys facing North, A is 16th from left and C is 16th from right. B is 4th to right of A and 5th to left of C. How many boys are there?
explanation: Left--15--A--3--B--4--C--15--Right. A is 16. B is 16+4=20. B is 5th left of C. C is 20+5=25. Total = 25 (pos of C) + 15 (right of C) = 40.

question: Seven friends are sitting in a row. P is exactly in the middle. Q is to the left of P but right of S. T is to the right of P. R is to the right of S but left of Q. Who is at the extreme left?
explanation: Order: S - R - Q - P - T... S is at the extreme left.

question: Six friends M, N, O, P, Q and R are sitting in a circle facing the centre. N is between O and P. M is between O and Q. R and P are standing together. Who is sitting between M and R?
explanation: Order: Q - M - O - N - P - R. Between M and R is Q.

question: Ten students are sitting in a row facing North. A is 2nd from left end. B is 3rd from right end. If they interchange positions, A becomes 2nd from right end. How can this be?
explanation: Original: 2nd from Left. New: 2nd from Right. B was 3rd from Right. If A moves to B's spot, B's spot is 2nd from Right. Contradiction (B was 3rd from Right). Not possible.

question: Five friends are sitting in a circle facing center. A is left of B. C is between B and D. E is right of A. Who is right of C?
explanation: Order: A - B - C - D - E. Right of C is D. Wait. Left of B is A (B->A). Right of A is E (A->E). C between B and D (B-C-D). Order: E-A-B-C-D. Right of C (Counter-Clockwise) is B.

question: A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H are sitting in a line facing North. E sits fourth to right of B. E sits second to left of H. D and A are sitting at extreme ends. F sits next to A. Who sits exactly in the middle of the row?
explanation: 8 people. Even number. No single middle person.

question: Six people are sitting in two parallel rows. Row 1: P, Q, R facing South. Row 2: A, B, C facing North. P faces B. Q is at one end. A is left of C. Who faces R?
explanation: Row 1 (South): Q-P-R. Row 2 (North): C-B-A. P faces B. Q faces C. R faces A.

question: Eight persons are sitting around a rectangular table, two on each side. A and B are opposite each other. C and D are opposite each other. E and F are on the same side. G and H are on the same side. If A is on the side with G, who is on the side with B?
explanation: Pairs: (A, G), (B, H). A opposite B. G must be opposite H.

question: Seven persons are sitting in a circle. A is second to the left of B and second to the right of C. D is between B and F. E is neighbor of C. Who is neighbor of A?
explanation: Order: C - G - A - F - D - B - E. Neighbors of A are G and F.

question: In a row of 40 students facing North, R is 11th from the left and S is 31st from the left. How far is S from R?
Five friends are sitting on a bench. A is to the left of B but on the right of C. D is to the right of B but on the left of E. Who are at the extremes?
explanation: Order: C - A - B - D - E. Extremes are C and E.

question: Six people A, B, C, D, E and F are sitting in a hexagon shape. A is opposite D. B is opposite E. C is opposite F. A is between B and F. Who is between E and C?
explanation: Order: A-B-C-D-E-F. A between B and F? No, F-A-B. Then C opposite F. E opposite B. D opposite A. Between E and C is D.

question: A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H are sitting in a circle facing the centre. C is third to the left of A. E is fourth to the right of A. D is fourth to the left of B who is second to the right of A. Who is immediate right of A?
explanation: Order: A - H - B - E - C - F - D - G. Immediate right of A is H.

question: Five persons are standing in a line. One of the two persons at the extreme ends is a professor and the other is a businessman. An advocate is standing to the right of a student. A writer is to the left of the businessman. The student is standing between the professor and the advocate. Counting from the left, the advocate is at which place?
explanation: Prof - Stud - Adv - Writer - Biz. Advocate is 3rd.

question: Six persons are sitting in a circle facing the center. Parikh is between Babita and Narendra. Asha is between Chitra and Pankaj. Chitra is to the immediate left of Babita. Who is to the immediate right of Babita?
explanation: Order: Babita - Parikh - Narendra - Pankaj - Asha - Chitra. Right of Babita (Anti-clockwise) is Parikh.

question: A, B, C, D and E are sitting in a row facing North. C is 2 places away from A. E is 2 places away from D. B is at the middle. A is at the left end. Who is at the right end?
explanation: A - ? - B - ? - ?. C is 2 away from A (A..C). So A - ? - C. B is middle. A-D-B-C-E. E is 2 away from D. E is at right end.

question: Eight friends are sitting in a circle facing the centre. A is 2nd left of B. C is 2nd left of A. D is 2nd left of C. E is 2nd left of D. F is 2nd left of E. Who is opposite A?
explanation: Positions 1 to 8. B=1, A=3, C=5, D=7, E=1... Wait. E is 2nd left of D (pos 7) -> pos 1. So E=B? No. 8 friends. 1, 3, 5, 7, 1... Skips 1. So A, C, D, E are occupying odd seats. Opposite A (3) is 7 (D). Wait. Opposite is +4. 3+4=7. Answer D.

question: Six persons are sitting in a row. A is to the left of B. C is to the right of B. D is to the left of A. E is to the left of D. F is to the right of C. Who are the neighbors of B?
explanation: Order: E - D - A - B - C - F. Neighbors of B are A and C.
